narrative.title: 2Nd New Zealand Division - 1941Q4
narrative.situation: British Infantry Division (Commonwealth - New Zealand) deployed in North Africa during 1941Q4.
narrative.objectives: Elite combined-arms infantry division optimized for aggressive offensive operations and mobile desert warfare
narrative.axis_objective: Hold current positions and prevent Allied breakthrough.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and neutralize Axis defensive positions.

weather.terrain: coastal plain and rocky desert (Sidi Rezegh - Tobruk corridor)

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Exceptional unit cohesion and morale (volunteer force)
Proven leadership in Mediterranean theater (Greece, Crete, North Africa)
Strong artillery support with experienced gunnery
28th (Maori) Battalion elite shock troops for night attacks
Divisional Cavalry provides mobile reconnaissance screen

environment.terrain_type: coastal plain and rocky desert (Sidi Rezegh - Tobruk corridor)
